item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone Go Off the Deep End With New Shark Skin Bundle
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-and-warzone-go-off-the-deep-end-with-new-shark-skin-bundle

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone’s descent into the weird and wonderful continues this week with a shark skin that does exactly what you’d expect: turn you into a shark.

The G’Day Bait Tracer Pack, priced 2,400 Call of Duty Points or around $20, includes the Bloke Biter shark skin for operator Carver.

As is Call of Duty tradition, you can’t buy the shark skin on its own. You can only get it as part of a bundle that includes weapon blueprints and a bunch of cosmetics designed to add value to that $20 purchase. Check it out in the screenshot gallery below.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone's Bloke Biter Shark Skin Screenshots

COD’s shark skin comes as no surprise. Indeed, Activision had signalled its arrival as part of Black Ops 6 and Warzone Season 1, although only now are we seeing it in all its glory. But it has revived commentary about Call of Duty’s silly outfits, weapon skins, and other visual effects that some have said they’d actually pay not to see in-game.

Let’s remember that Black Ops 6 is a game packed with zombies, and as for operator skins already lets you play dress up as a dragon knight, a parasite warrior, and a raccoon. If you’re playing Black Ops 6 Multiplayer during Season 1 you’ll have no-doubt spotted these outlandish visual effects out in the battlefield. Now, COD’s jaws-dropping shark skin is in the wild, Nuketown just got a lot fishier.

Speaking of Zombies mode, we've got Essential Zombies Tips and Tricks to help you get started, plus a guide on How to Exfil. Both Zombies maps are full of easter eggs and secrets; here's everything we've found in both Terminus and Liberty Falls, including How to Pack-a-Punch in Liberty Falls and How to Get the Meteor Easter Egg in Terminus.

Wesley is the UK News Editor for IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.

item.title: Helldivers 2 Drops to $30 for Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/helldivers-2-drops-to-30-for-black-friday

The Target Black Friday sale gives you a reason to dive headfirst into intergalactic chaos without blowing your holiday budget. As of November 24, Helldivers 2 for PlayStation 5 is marked down to just $29.99. That’s 25% off the usual $39.99 price tag, meaning you’ll save $10 while signing up to save humanity.

Hell Divers 2 - PlayStation 5

Set in the not-so-friendly expanse of the galaxy, Helldivers 2 lets you join squads of up to four players to take on equally thrilling and chaotic missions. You’ll face swarms of alien enemies, customize your loadouts to rain down destruction, and wrestle with the constant danger of friendly fire (hey, accidents happen). With gameplay that’s fast, ferocious, and just a bit bonkers.

Whether you prefer to sneak through enemy territory or go full Rambo with explosions galore, Helldivers 2 has you covered. The game’s loadout options let you tailor your approach to combat and possibly earn some bragging rights along the way. (Try not to “accidentally” take out your squad mates with a misplaced grenade. We’ve all been there.)

Black Friday is the perfect excuse to add this gem to your PS5 collection. The $29.99 price tag makes it one of the better deals we’ve seen for a highly rated recently released game. Whether you’re playing solo or coordinating mayhem with friends, Helldivers 2 promises endless hours of galactic carnage.

Our review for Helldivers 2 scored a 9/10 as a multiplayer breath of fresh air: "Helldivers 2's combat feels fantastic, its missions stay fresh and interesting, and its smart progression system doesn’t nickel and dime you."

But like any good Black Friday deal, this one won’t last forever. Head to Target before your chance to save $10 blasts off into space.

Originally posted:

Nov 25, 2024 4:25 pm
